overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a detailed, cautious approach to time-series forecasting with limited data (96 hourly points). The analyst evaluates multiple methods, acknowledges data constraints, and prioritizes simplicity due to insufficient history for robust trend/seasonality modeling. The final solution uses a practical baseline method after extensive consideration of alternatives.
common_data_patterns: Potential upward trend (based on daily averages)
No missing values in historical data
key_insights: Limited data (4 days) complicates trend/seasonality modeling, favoring simple methods
Daily seasonality exists but shows instability across days
Averaging same-hour values creates a repeatable daily profile as a baseline
Rounding forecasts to match input data precision (3 decimals)
Explicit rejection of complex models (SARIMA, Prophet) due to overfitting risks
complexity_analysis: Highly detailed multi-step analysis: evaluates 5+ models, computes hourly/daily statistics, and justifies method selection through data pattern examination and parameter constraints.
